content: The "First-Time Homebuyer Tax Credit Act of 1997" is cited as the short title. It introduces a new section providing a tax credit for first-time homebuyers in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The First-Time Homebuyer Tax Credit Act of 1997 allows a 10% credit on the purchase price of a principal residence for first-time homebuyers, with a maximum credit of $5,000. The credit is limited to one residence per taxpayer, and for married couples filing jointly, both spouses must be first-time homebuyers to qualify. For individuals purchasing the same residence together, each must be a first-time homebuyer, and the credit is limited to $5,000 or 10% of the total purchase price.
